results.name: T(n,k) = 4*binomial(n,k) - 3*I(n,k), where I is the identity matrix; triangle T read by rows (n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = 4*A007318(n,k) - 3*I(n,k), where A007318 = Pascal's triangle and I = Identity matrix.
Bivariate o.g.f.: Sum_{n,k>=0} T(n,k)*x^n*y^k = (1 + 3*x - x*y)/((1 - x*y)*(1 - x - x*y)). - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Feb 20 2021
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k = 0..n) begins:
maple: seq(seq(`if`(k=n, 1, 4*binomial(n,k)), k=0..n), n=0..10); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
program: (MAGMA) [k eq n select 1 else 4*Binomial(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)]
Flat(List([0..10], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
